bibl.title: Ecateo di Abdera e la prima katoikia di Giudei in Egitto (Giuseppe, Contra Apionem I 186-9).
bibl.note: Offers a reconsideration and a new translation of a passage in Josephus' Contra Apionem (I 186-9), which quotes from the historical work by Hecataeus of Abdera. The passage deals with the deportation in Egypt of a group of Jews after the Egyptian conquest of Syria and Palestine by king Ptolemy I Soter (battle of Gaza, 312 a.C.). The passage documents the foundation of the first organized Jewish community (katoikia) in Egypt, and suggests that the civil rights (politeia) of this community were regulated by the king, probably through a royal edict. - Avec résumé en anglais.
